docblock.description: Representation of the Actor of a notification
Representation of the Actor of a notification
Represents the type of the data the actro holds.

tag.name: example
tag.description: 'uid' -> might represent a user id in the system that generates the notifications. 'twitter_handle' -> might represent the Twitter username of the user to notify.

docblock.description: Represents the actual endpoint.

tag.name: example
tag.description: Type could be 'uid', and thus Data should be an integer like 5.

docblock.description: Returns the type of the recipient, to be set by the recipient creator.
Represents the data representing the recipient, of any arbitrary type.
Initialise and set the values of the Actor

tag.name: param
tag.description: Represents the type of Actor, like 'user_id', 'twitter_handle', etc.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Represents the data required for the Actor to be used as an endpoint.

docblock.description: Factory that can generate and hold notifications.
Factory that can generate and hold notifications.
Object ID
Arbitrary string that describes the type of the payload.
Arbitrary string that describes the operation that has been executed (or has been or will be executed) on the payload.
Arbitrary payload that has been altered
Origin of the notification. This is typically a plugin or module.
Default message for new notifications.
Default sender for new Notifications.
Default recipients for new Notifications.
docblock.long-description: All recipients should be of type Recipient.

docblock.description: Array of notification objects
Internal array for dynamic properties
Initialise the factory, setting the default properties which will be forwarded to the created notifications.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the module that will receive this factory for the generate phase.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Type of the content that has been passed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The operation that has been executed (or will be executed) on the payload, which is the trigger for the notification process.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The piece of content which has acted upon.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The sender object which will be passed to the generated notification objects.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The recipient object which will be passed to the generated notification objects.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The message that will be passed to the generated notification objects.

docblock.description: Generates a notification, setting the properties to the default properties of the factory.
docblock.long-description: Adds a reference to the factory (this object) that has created the notification.

docblock.description: Store a notification back in the bender factory
Instruct notifications to send
Return the type of the payload, which triggered this notification process.

tag.name: example
tag.description: 'post' -> The payload corresponds to what the system understands as a post type.

docblock.description: Return the operation that was executed on the payload, which is the trigger to the notification process.

tag.name: example
tag.description: 'created' -> Can mean that the payload has just been created in the system. 'like' -> Can mean that the payload has just been tagged as liked by a user.

docblock.description: Return the payload that is associated with the operation.
docblock.long-description: This can be any type of content in the system.

docblock.description: Return a string of the module that implemented this factory
Returns the value of a dynamic property of this object.
Sets the value of a dynamic property of this object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: New value for the dynamic property

docblock.description: Rewind the list of notifications to the beginning
Return the current notification
Return the current notification being pointed at by the array's internal pointer Required for Iterator class
Returns the next notification.
Checks if position on our internal array hasn't run out on us.
Updates a given notification by key, first checking if it's the same notification.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The id that was generated by the notification on generation. Which is used by the factory as a key to point to the notification.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The notification which has been updated.

tag.description: 'created' -> Can mean that the payload has just been created in the system. 'like' -> Can mean that the payload has just been tagged as liked by a user.

docblock.description: Return the payload that is associated with the operation.
